page.title: 18Multicultural Education
page.content: {Multicultural Education}is a system of {education}in which the curriculum is altered to involve the cultures of the {minority groups}There are people from India, Pakistan, Bangladesh and China at Drummond Community High{School.}A glimpse of the cultures of these countries is given by the formation of several clubs such as the 'Asian Girls Club'. Performances by musicians of different countries and teaching of Asian languages outside school hours all help to encourage appreciation of cultures other than the British. Stalls selling Indian, Caribbean and Scottish food are often set up to give people a taste of what is eaten in others' homes. As an Asian, these changes, in my opinion, are helping to bridge the gap between the eastern and western cultures in the{school}where we were once greatly divided.
